name: Maududi
text: Highly blessed is He, Who has sent down Al-Furqan, to His servant so that it may be a warner to all mankind:

name: Maududi
text: He to Whom belongs the Sovereignty of the heavens and the earth: Who has begotten no son: Who has no partner in His Sovereignty: Who created each and every thing and then ordained its destiny.

name: Maududi
text: Yet the people have set up, besides Him, deities, who do not create anything but are themselves created: who can neither harm nor help even themselves: who have no power over life or death, nor can they raise up the dead.

name: Maududi
text: Those who have rejected the Message of the Prophet, say, "This (Al-Furgan) is a forgery which this man himself has devised, and some others have helped him at it. " What a cruel injustice and an impudent lie!

name: Maududi
text: They say, "These things are the writings of the ancients which he has got copied down for himself, and then these are recited to him in the morning and evening.''

name: Maududi
text: O Muhammad, say to them, "This has been sent down by Him, Who knows the secret of the heavens and the earth." The fact is that He is very Forgiving and Merciful.

name: Maududi
text: They say, "What sort of a Messenger is he that he eats food and moves about in the streets? Why has not an angel been sent down to accompany him and threaten (the disbelievers)?

name: Maududi
text: Or why has not at least a treasure been sent down for him or a garden given to him for (easy) sustenance?" And the wicked people say, "You are following a man bewitched."

name: Maududi
text: Just see what strange arguments they bring forward with regard to you! They have gone so far astray that they cannot charge any thing against you.

name: Maududi
text: Highly blessed is He, Who, if He wills, could give you much more and better things than what they propose for you: (Not one but) many gardens, beneath which rivers flow; and big castles:

name: Maududi
text: The fact of the matter is that these people have denied "the Hour", --And for the one who denies the coming of the Hour, We have prepared a blazing Fire.

name: Maududi
text: When it will see them from afar, they will hear the sounds of its raging and roaring.

name: Maududi
text: And when they are chained together and flung into a narrow space therein, they will begin to call for death.

name: Maududi
text: (Then it will be said to them:) "Do not call for one death today, but call for many deaths."

name: Maududi
text: Ask them "Is this (Fire) better or the everlasting Garden which has been promised to the God-fearing righteous people?" which will be the recompense of their good deeds and the final destination of their journey

name: Maududi
text: wherein they will get everything they desire and wherein they will dwell for ever. This is a promise which your Lord has taken upon Himself to fulfil.

name: Maududi
text: And on that Day (your Lord will gather these people together as well as their deities, whom they worship besides AIlah. Then He will ask them, "Did you mislead these servants of Mine, or did they themselves go astray?"

name: Maududi
text: They will answer, "Glory be to Thee! We dared not take anyguardian besides Thee: (they were misled because) Thou didst give them and their forefathers all the good things of life till they forgot the Admonition, and incurred the punishment. "

name: Maududi
text: Thus will your gods deny alI that you are professing today. Then you shall neither be able to repel your punishment nor shall get any help from anywhere; and whoso is guilty. of iniquity'' among you, We shall make him taste a severe torment.

name: Maududi
text: O Muhammad,, all the Messengers whom We sent before you also ate food and moved about in the streets. In fact, We have made you all a means of test for one another. Will you show patience? for your Lord sees everything.

name: Maududi
text: Those people, who have no fear of coming before Us, say, "Why should not the angels be sent down to us? Or else we should see our Lord. " Great arrogance have they assumed in regard to themselves, and have transgressed all limits in their rebellion.

name: Maududi
text: The Day, when they will see the angels, will not be a day of rejoicing for the criminals; they will cry out, "May Allah save us!"

name: Maududi
text: Then We shall turn to what they had done and render it vain like scattered dust.

name: Maududi
text: (On the contrary) only those who have deserved the Garden, will have a good abode on that Day and a cool place for midday rest.

name: Maududi
text: On that Day, a cloud will appear rending the sky and the angels will be senthi down rank after rank.

name: Maududi
text: The real Kingdom on that Day will belong only to the Merciful, and it will be a very hard Day for the disbelievers.

name: Maududi
text: The unjust man will bite at his hand and say, "Would that I had stood by the Messenger!

name: Maududi
text: O, woe to me! Would that I had not chosen so and so for a friend!

name: Maududi
text: For it was he, who had deluded me to reject the Admonition which had come to me. Satan has proved very treacherous to man. "

name: Maududi
text: And the Messenger will say, "O my Lord, my people had made this Qur'an the object of their ridicule."

name: Maududi
text: O Muhammad, in this very way We have made the criminals the enemies of every Prophet, but your Lord suffices for you as your Guide and Helper.

name: Maududi
text: The disbelievers say, "Why has not the entire Qur'an been sent down to this man all at nce?" -Well, this has been done to impress it deeply on your mind, and (for the same object) We have sent it down piecemeal by degrees.

name: Maududi
text: And (there is another wisdom in this: whenever they brought to you an odd thing (or a strange question), We sent its right answer to you in time and explained it all in the best manner,

name: Maududi
text: those who are going to be driven to Hell upon their faces, have taken an utterly wrong stand and their way is most erroneous!

name: Maududi
text: We gave Moses the Book and appointed his brother Aaron as his counsellor:

name: Maududi
text: then We said to them, "Go to the people who have treated Our Revelations as false. " So We annihilated those people utterly.

name: Maududi
text: The same was the case with the people of Noah when they charged the Messenger with imposture: We drowned them and made them a sign of warning for entire mankind, and We have prepared a painful chastisement for the unjust.

name: Maududi
text: Likewise were destroyed the `Ad and the Thamud and the people of the Rass, and many a generation in between.

name: Maududi
text: We admonished each one of them by citing the examples (of those who were destroyed before them) and ultimately annihilated all of them.

name: Maududi
text: Surely, these people have passed by that habitation on which was rained an evil rain: have they not seen its ruins? But they do not expect another life in the Hereafter.

name: Maududi
text: When these people see you, they scoff at you, (saying), "Is this the man whom Allah has sent as His Messenger?

name: Maududi
text: He had almost led us astray from our gods, had we not remained firm in our faith with regard to them. " The time is not far when they will see the torment and realize who had strayed far from the truth.

name: Maududi
text: Have you ever considered the case of the person who has made his lust his god? Can you take the responsibility of guiding such a one aright?

name: Maududi
text: Do you think that most of them hear or understand? They are only like the cattle; nay, even worse than the cattle.

name: Maududi
text: Have you not seen how your Lord lengthens out the shadow? Had He willed, He would have made it constant, but We have made the sun its pilot;

name: Maududi
text: then (as the sun climbs up), We roll it up little by little towards Ourselves.

name: Maududi
text: And it is Allah Who has ordained the night as a garment for you, and the sleep as a repose of death, and the day as the time of return to life.

name: Maududi
text: And it is He, Who drives the winds to be the harbingers of His mercy: then He sends down pure water from the sky

name: Maududi
text: so that He may revive the dead land, and quench the thirst of many of His creatures from among beasts and men.

name: Maududi
text: We present the same phenomenon over and over again before them so that they may learn a lesson from it; but most people decline to adopt any other attitude than of disbelief and ingratitude.

name: Maududi
text: Had We willed, We would have raised up a separate Warner in each habitation.

name: Maududi
text: So, O Prophet, do not yield to the disbelievers, but wage a Jihad against them with this Qur'an.

name: Maududi
text: And it is He, Who has let loose the two seas, one palatable and sweet, the other bitter and saltish, and there is a partition between them, which is an insurmountable barrier.

name: Maududi
text: And it is He, Who created man from water: then from him He caused two kinds of kindred, by blood and by marriage: your Lord is AI I-Powerful.

name: Maududi
text: Yet they worship, instead of Allah, those who can neither benefit them nor harm them: more than this, the disbeliever has become a helper of every rebel against his Lord.

name: Maududi
text: O Muhammad, We have sent you only to proclaim good tidings and to give warning.

name: Maududi
text: Tell them, "I do not ask of you any recompense for this work: I only ask of the one, who will, to adopt the way of his Lord.

name: Maududi
text: O Muhammad trust in that Allah Who is Ever-Living and will never die' Glorify Him with His praise, for He alone is sufficient to be aware of the sins of His servants.

name: Maududi
text: In six days He created the earth and the heavens and all that is between them; then He established Himself on the "Throne" (of the Kingdom of the uriverse). (He is) the Merciful: as to His Glory, ask the one who knows.

name: Maududi
text: When it is said to them. "Prostrate yourselves before the Merciful," they retort, "What is the Merciful? Would you have us prostrate ourselves before whomsoever you will?" And this invitation only helps to increase their hatred all the more.

name: Maududi
text: Highly blessed is He, Who has made fortified spheres in the heavens and has set in it a "lamp" and a shining moon.

name: Maududi
text: He it is Who caused the night and the day to succeed each other so that everyone who desires may learn a lesson or become grateful.

name: Maududi
text: The (true) servants of the Merciful are those who walk humbly on the earth who, when the ignorant people behave insolently towards them, say, "Peace to you"

name: Maududi
text: who pass their nights in prostrating themselves and standing before their Lord:

name: Maududi
text: who pray, "Our Lord, save us from the torment of Hell, for its torment is killing:

name: Maududi
text: it is an evil abode and an evil resting place":

name: Maududi
text: who, when they spend, are neither extravagant nor miserly but keep the golden mean between the two (extremes):

name: Maududi
text: who do not invoke any god but Allah nor kill a soul, which Allah has forbidden, unjustly, nor commit adultery. -He who does this shall be punished for his sin,

name: Maududi
text: and his torment shall be doubled on the Day of Resurrection, and he shall abide in a state of ignominy,

name: Maududi
text: except the one who may have repented (after those sins) and have believed and done righteous works, for then Allah will change his evil deeds into good deeds, and He is very Forgiving and Merciful.

name: Maududi
text: In fact, the one who repents and does righteous deeds, returns to Allah as one ightly should. -

name: Maududi
text: (And the servants of the Merciful are those:) who do not bear witness to falsehood and who; if they have ever to pass by what is vain, pass by like dignified people:

name: Maududi
text: who do not behave like the blind and the deaf, when the Revelations of their Lord are recited to them for admonition;

name: Maududi
text: who pray, "Our Lord, bless us with wives and children, who may be the comfort of our eyes, and make us leaders of the righteous. " -

name: Maududi
text: Such are the people who will be rewarded with high palaces for their fortitude,, wherein they will be welcomed with due respect, honour and salutations

name: Maududi
text: and wherein they will live for ever: what an excellent abode and what an excellent resting place!

name: Maududi
text: O Muhammad, tell the people, "MyLord does not care at all if you do not invoke Him. Now that you have denied (His Revelation), you will soon be awarded such a punishment which you will never be able to avoid."
